headline: Walmart (NYSE:WMT) Partners With Nitro Circus For Exciting Retailtainment Tour
summary: Walmart (NYSE:WMT) recently launched a 12-stop 'retailtainment' tour with Nitro Circus, enhancing community engagement through BMX stunt shows at select locations, highlighted by Ryan Williams. This initiative aims to increase brand visibility, aligning with the broader retail and logistical expansions, including its new distribution and beef facilities. Despite a 20% price increase in the last quarter, Walmart's performance reflects ongoing market trends, as the broader indices like S&P 500...

headline: Walmart, Sam’s Club and the Walmart Foundation Commit up to $500,000 to Support Texas Flood Relief Efforts
summary: BENTONVILLE, Ark., July 07, 2025--Walmart, along with Sam’s Club and the Walmart Foundation, are stepping up to support communities in South Texas following the devastating floods. Together, they are committing up to $500,000 in grants and in-kind donations to support relief efforts in the region. This includes up to a $250,000 match of customer and member donations, that can soon be made online or in-stores and clubs in Texas, through the Walmart and Salvation Army match campaign.

headline: grace & stella Expands Retail Presence in Canada with Amazon, Costco, and Walmart Launches
summary: grace & stella, the viral beauty and self-care brand beloved for its "feel-good moments" and cult-favourite products like the iconic under-eye masks and hydrating sprays, is proud to announce a major retail expansion across Canada. This summer, Canadian consumers will be able to shop grace & stella on Amazon.ca and in select Costco warehouses nationwide, with plans underway to enter Walmart brick-and-mortar stores later this year.

headline: Amazon Prime Day set to lift US online sales to $23.8 billion, Adobe estimates
summary: Retailers recorded online sales worth $14.2 billion during the two-day Amazon shopping event last July.  "This is equivalent to two Black Fridays," Adobe noted, adding that budget-conscious consumers are adjusting their shopping habits by using generative AI to find deals and get an early start on back-to-school purchases.  Shoppers are expected to take advantage of steep discounts to “trade up” to higher-ticket items such as electronics, sporting goods, and appliances, while opting for more affordable alternatives in categories like home and garden or groceries.
